translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The ninth section
The discussion of the past, the future, and the present
“Is one possessed of the past?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu atītaṁ niruddhaṁ vigataṁ vipariṇataṁ atthaṅgataṁ abbhatthaṅgatanti?
analyzed: nanu atītam niruddham vigatam vipariṇatam atthaṅgatam abbhatthaṅgatam ti
translated: “Isn’t the past ceased, ended, changed?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci atītaṁ niruddhaṁ vigataṁ vipariṇataṁ atthaṅgataṁ abbhatthaṅgataṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—🔽“atītena samannāgato”ti.
analyzed: āmantā  hañci atītam niruddham vigatam vipariṇatam atthaṅgatam abbhatthaṅgata no ca vata re vattabbe  atītena samannāgatā iti
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Then it’s not correct to say, ‘One is possessed of the past.’”
“Is one possessed of the future?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu anāgataṁ ajātaṁ abhūtaṁ asañjātaṁ anibbattaṁ anabhinibbattaṁ apātubhūtanti?
analyzed: nanu anāgatam a jātam a bhūtam a sañjātam a nibbattam an abhinibbattam a pātubhūtanti
translated: “Isn’t the future not yet come, not having arisen, not manifest, not arisen, not been produced?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci anāgataṁ ajātaṁ abhūtaṁ asañjātaṁ anibbattaṁ anabhinibbattaṁ apātubhūtaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci anāgatam a jātam a bhūtam a sañjātam a nibbattam an abhinibbattam a pātubhūta no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”
“Then it’s not correct to say, ‘One is possessed of the future.’”

original: Atītena rūpakkhandhena samannāgato, anāgatena rūpakkhandhena samannāgato, paccuppannena rūpakkhandhena samannāgatoti?
analyzed: atītena rūpa kkhandhena samannāgataḥ anāgatena rūpa kkhandhena samannāgataḥ paccuppannena rūpa kkhandhena samannāgataḥ ti
translated: “Is one possessed of the form aggregate of the past, the future, and the present?”
“Yes.”
“Is he endowed with the three form-constituents?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: atītehi pañcahi khandhehi samannāgato, anāgatehi pañcahi khandhehi samannāgato, paccuppannehi pañcahi khandhehi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: atītehi pañcahi khandhehi samannāgataḥ anāgatehi pañcahi khandhehi samannāgataḥ paccuppannehi pañcahi khandhehi samannāgataḥ ti
translated: “Is he endowed with the five aggregates of the past, the five aggregates of the future, and the five aggregates of the present?”
“Yes.”
“Is he endowed with the fifteen aggregates?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: Atītena cakkhāyatanena samannāgato, anāgatena cakkhāyatanena samannāgato, paccuppannena cakkhāyatanena samannāgatoti?
analyzed: atītena cakkhu āyatanena samannāgato anāgatena cakkhu āyatanena samannāgato paccuppannena cakkhu āyatanena samannāgatoti
translated: “Is he endowed with the eye-faculty of the past, the eye-faculty of the future, and the eye-faculty of the present?”
“Yes.”
“Is he endowed with the three eye-faculties?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: atītehi dvādasahi āyatanehi samannāgato, anāgatehi dvādasahi āyatanehi samannāgato, paccuppannehi dvādasahi āyatanehi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: atītehi dvādasahi āyatanehi samannāgataḥ anāgatehi dvādasahi āyatanehi samannāgataḥ paccuppannehi dvādasahi āyatanehi samannāgataḥ ti
translated: “Is he endowed with the twelve sense-spheres of the past, the twelve sense-spheres of the future, and the twelve sense-spheres of the present?”
“Yes.”
“Is he endowed with the thirty-six sense-spheres?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: Atītāya cakkhudhātuyā samannāgato, anāgatāya cakkhudhātuyā samannāgato, paccuppannāya cakkhudhātuyā samannāgatoti?
analyzed: atītāya cakkhu dhātuyā samannāgato anāgatāya cakkhu dhātuyā samannāgato paccuppannāya cakkhu dhātuyā samannāgatoti
translated: Is he one who possesses the past eye element, the future eye element, and the present eye element?
“Yes.”
“Is he one who possesses three eye elements?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: atītāhi aṭṭhārasahi dhātūhi samannāgato, anāgatāhi aṭṭhārasahi dhātūhi samannāgato, paccuppannāhi aṭṭhārasahi dhātūhi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: atītāhi aṭṭhārasahi dhātūhi samannāgataḥ anāgatāhi aṭṭhārasahi dhātūhi samannāgataḥ paccuppannāhi aṭṭhārasahi dhātūhi samannāgataḥ ti
translated: “Is he one who possesses the past eighteen elements, the future eighteen elements, and the present eighteen elements?”
“Yes.”
“Is he one who possesses fifty-four elements?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the abandoning of lust, the abandoning of hatred, the abandoning of delusion?

original: Atītena cakkhundriyena samannāgato, anāgatena cakkhundriyena samannāgato, paccuppannena cakkhundriyena samannāgatoti?
analyzed: atītena cakkhundriyena samannāgato anāgatena cakkhundriyena samannāgato paccuppannena cakkhundriyena samannāgatoti
translated: “Is he one who possesses the past eye faculty, the future eye faculty, and the present eye faculty?”
“Yes.”
“Is he one who possesses three eye faculties?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: atītehi bāvīsatindriyehi samannāgato, anāgatehi bāvīsatindriyehi samannāgato, paccuppannehi bāvīsatindriyehi samannāgatoti?
analyzed: atītehi bāvīsati indriyehi samannāgataḥ anāgatehi bāvīsati indriyehi samannāgataḥ paccuppannehi bāvīsati indriyehi samannāgataḥ ti
translated: “Is he one who possesses the past twenty-two faculties, the future twenty-two faculties, and the present twenty-two faculties?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: cha saṭṭh indriyehi samannāgataḥ ti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Endowed with the six faculties of the past and the future?”
“No, friend.”
“It’s not to be said that he is endowed with the past and the future.”
“Agreed.”

original: Nanu atthi aṭṭhavimokkhajhāyī catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ nikāmalābhī navannaṁ anupubbavihārasamāpattīnaṁ lābhīti?
analyzed: nanu atthi aṭṭha vimokkha jhāyī catunnam jhānānam nikāma lābhī navannam anupubba vihāra samāpattīnam lābhī iti
translated: “But, friend, is there a meditator who has attained the eight liberations, who has attained the nine successive dwellings, who has attained the four jhānas, who has attained the four formless attainments, who has attained the four noble paths, who has attained the four fruits?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci atthi aṭṭhavimokkhajhāyī catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ nikāmalābhī navannaṁ anupubbavihārasamāpattīnaṁ lābhī, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci atthi aṭṭha vimokkha jhāyī catunnam jhānānam nikāma lābhī navannam anupubba vihāra samāpattīnam lābhī tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “Agreed.”
“Then it must be said that he is endowed with the past and the future.”

analyzed: atīta anāgata paccuppanna kathā niṭṭhitā  navamaḥ vaggo
translated: The Discussion of the Past, Future, and Present is finished.

original: Tassuddānaṁ🔽Ānisaṁsadassāvissa saṁyojanānaṁ pahānaṁ, amatārammaṇaṁ saṁyojanaṁ, rūpaṁ sārammaṇaṁ,
analyzed: tassa uddāna  sayojanānam pahāna amata ārammaṇa sayojana rūpam sa ārammaṇa
translated: The ninth section is finished.🔽The summary:🔽Benefits, seeing, abandoning the fetters, the deathless as object, fetters, form as object,

original: anusayā anārammaṇā, evamevaṁ ñāṇaṁ, atītānāgatārammaṇaṁ cittaṁ, sabbaṁ cittaṁ vitakkānupatitaṁ,
analyzed: anusayāḥ anārammaṇāḥ evam evam ñāṇa atīta anāgata ārammaṇam citta sabbam cittam vitakka anupatita
translated: latent tendencies, not an object, and likewise knowledge, the past and future as object, all consciousness is accompanied by thinking,

original: sabbaso vitakkayato vicārayato vitakkavipphāro saddo, na yathācittassa vācā, tatheva
analyzed: sabbasas vitakkayataḥ vicārayataḥ vitakka vipphāraḥ saddaḥ na yathā a cittassa vācā tathā iva
translated: When he is thinking and pondering, then there is sound as the intimation of his thoughts, not speech as there is in one whose thoughts are in accordance with his speech.

analyzed: kāya kammaṃ atīta anāgatehi samannāgataḥ ti
translated: But he is not provided with bodily action in the past and future.
